Package camzup.core

Class Curve3.Knot3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Curve3.Knot3
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Curve3.Knot3>
Enclosing class:
Curve3
public static class Curve3.Knot3
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Curve3.Knot3>
Groups together vectors which shape a Bezier curve into a coordinate (or anchor point), fore handle (the following control point) and rear handle (the preceding control point).

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Vec3 coord
    The spatial coordinate of the knot.
    Vec3 foreHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.
    Vec3 rearHandle
    The handle which warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Knot3()
    The default constructor.
    Knot3​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float zCoord)
    Creates a knot from a coordinate.

    Creates a knot from real numbers.
    Knot3​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float zCoord, float xFore, float yFore, float zFore, float xRear, float yRear, float zRear)
    Creates a knot from real numbers.

    Creates a knot from a source knot.
    Knot3​(Vec3 coord)
    Creates a knot from a coordinate.
    Knot3​(Vec3 coord, Vec3 foreHandle)
    Creates a knot from a coordinate and fore-handle.

    Attempts to create a knot from Strings.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Curve3.Knot3 alignHandles​(Vec3 foreDir, Vec3 rearDir, Vec3 foreScaled)
    Aligns this knot's handles in the same direction while preserving their magnitude.
    Curve3.Knot3 alignHandlesBackward​(Vec3 foreDir, Vec3 rearDir, Vec3 foreScaled)
    Aligns this knot's fore handle to its rear handle while preserving magnitude.
    Curve3.Knot3 alignHandlesForward​(Vec3 rearDir, Vec3 foreDir, Vec3 rearScaled)
    Aligns this knot's rear handle to its fore handle while preserving magnitude.
    Curve3.Knot3 clone()
    Creates a new knot with the coordinate and handles of this knot.
    int compareTo​(Curve3.Knot3 knot)
    Compares this knot to another based on a comparison between coordinates.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
    Tests to see if this knot equals an object
    static Curve3.Knot3 fromPolar​(float angle, float radius, float handleMag, Curve3.Knot3 target)
    Creates a knot from polar coordinates, where the knot's fore handle is tangent to the radius.
    int hashCode()
    Returns the knot's hash code based on those of its three constituent vectors.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandles()
    Mirrors this knot's handles.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandles​(Vec3 temp)
    Mirrors this knot's handles.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesBackward()
    Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesBackward​(Vec3 rearDir)
    Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesForward()
    Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.
    Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesForward​(Vec3 foreDir)
    Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.
    Curve3.Knot3 reverse()
    Reverses the knot's direction by swapping the fore- and rear-handles.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotate​(float cosa, float sina, Vec3 axis)
    Rotates this knot around an axis by an angle in radians.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotate​(float radians, Vec3 axis)
    Rotates this knot around an arbitrary axis by an angle in radians.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateX​(float radians)
    Rotates this knot around the x axis by an angle in radians.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateX​(float cosa, float sina)
    Rotates a knot around the x axis.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateY​(float radians)
    Rotates this knot around the y axis by an angle in radians.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateY​(float cosa, float sina)
    Rotates a knot around the y axis.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateZ​(float radians)
    Rotates this knot around the z axis by an angle in radians.
    Curve3.Knot3 rotateZ​(float cosa, float sina)
    Rotates a knot around the z axis.
    Curve3.Knot3 scale​(float scale)
    Scales this knot by a factor.
    Curve3.Knot3 scale​(Vec3 scale)
    Scales this knot by a non-uniform scalar.
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleForeHandleBy​(float scalar, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales the fore handle by a factor.
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleForeHandleTo​(float magnitude, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales the fore handle to a magnitude
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleHandlesBy​(float scalar, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales both the fore and rear handle by a factor.
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleHandlesTo​(float magnitude, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales both the fore and rear handle to a magnitude.
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleRearHandleBy​(float scalar, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales the rear handle by a factor.
    Curve3.Knot3 scaleRearHandleTo​(float magnitude, Vec3 temp0, Vec3 temp1)
    Scales the rear handle to a magnitude
    Curve3.Knot3 set​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float zCoord)
    Sets the coordinate, fore- and rear-handles to the input coordinate.

      public final Vec3 coord
      The spatial coordinate of the knot.

    • foreHandle

      public final Vec3 foreHandle
      The handle which warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.

    • rearHandle

      public final Vec3 rearHandle
      The handle which warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

      coord - the coordinate
      foreHandle - the fore handle

    • fromPolar

      public static Curve3.Knot3 fromPolar​(float angle, float radius, float handleMag, Curve3.Knot3 target)
      Creates a knot from polar coordinates, where the knot's fore handle is tangent to the radius.
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle in radians
      radius - the radius
      handleMag - the magnitude of the handles
      target - the output knot
      Returns:
      the knot

      rearDir - a temporary vector

      public Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandles()

    • mirrorHandlesBackward

      public Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesBackward()
      Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
      Returns:
      this knot

    • mirrorHandlesBackward

      public Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesBackward​(Vec3 rearDir)
      Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear. A temporary vector is required for the swap.
      Parameters:
      rearDir - a temp vector
      Returns:
      this knot

    • mirrorHandlesForward

      public Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesForward()
      Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.
      Returns:
      this knot

    • mirrorHandlesForward

      public Curve3.Knot3 mirrorHandlesForward​(Vec3 foreDir)
      Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore. A temporary vector is required for the swap.
      Parameters:
      foreDir - a temp vector
      Returns:
      this knot

    • reverse

      public Curve3.Knot3 reverse()
      Reverses the knot's direction by swapping the fore- and rear-handles.
      Returns:
      this knot

    • rotate

      public Curve3.Knot3 rotate​(float cosa, float sina, Vec3 axis)
      Rotates this knot around an axis by an angle in radians. The axis is assumed to be of unit length. Accepts pre-calculated sine and cosine of an angle, so that collections of knots can be efficiently rotated without repeatedly calling cos and sin.
      Parameters:
      cosa - cosine of the angle
      sina - sine of the angle
      axis - the axis of rotation
      Returns:
      this knot

    • rotate

      public Curve3.Knot3 rotate​(float radians, Vec3 axis)
      Rotates this knot around an arbitrary axis by an angle in radians.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle
      axis - the axis of rotation
      Returns:
      this knot

      public Curve3.Knot3 set​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float zCoord, float xFore, float yFore, float zFore)

      yCoord - the y coordinate
      zCoord - the z coordinate

      yFore - the forehandle y
      zFore - the forehandle z

      this knot

      public Curve3.Knot3 set​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float zCoord, float xFore, float yFore, float zFore, float xRear, float yRear, float zRear)
      Sets the knot's coordinate, forehandle and rearhandle by component.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - the x coordinate
      yCoord - the y coordinate
      zCoord - the z coordinate
      xFore - the forehandle x
      yFore - the forehandle y
      zFore - the forehandle z
      xRear - the rearhandle x
      yRear - the rearhandle y
      zRear - the rearhandle z

    • set

      public Curve3.Knot3 set​(java.lang.String xCoord, java.lang.String yCoord, java.lang.String zCoord, java.lang.String xFore, java.lang.String yFore, java.lang.String zFore, java.lang.String xRear, java.lang.String yRear, java.lang.String zRear)
      Attempts to set the components of this knot from Strings using Float.parseFloat(String) . If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - the x coordinate string
      yCoord - the y coordinate string
      zCoord - the z coordinate string
      xFore - the x fore handle string
      yFore - the y fore handle string
      zFore - the z fore handle string
      xRear - the x rear handle string
      yRear - the y rear handle string
      zRear - the z rear handle string
      Returns:
      this knot

      public float[][] toArray()
      Returns a 2D array representation of this knot. The coordinate is the first element; fore handle, the second; rear handle, the third.
